item.description:
Let's try something new and unique!  The Contemporary Theater Company's Studio has a series of plays in South Kingstown.  Seating is general admission and is an absolute steal at $15.  Let's give them a try and see how we like their concept.

The play is "Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind." Here is the description of the play:

Ready. Set. Go for a hilarious show of mini-plays that will have you roaring with laughter. Every night we present a menu of plays based on the audience's choosing ensuring a different experience every night.

Originally crafted by the Neofuturists, the play holds the title to the longest-running production of any show in Chicago . The high-energy production has been called everything from odd to experimental but mostly just plain funny.

So stop by, prepare to laugh and maybe even find a bit role on stage for the night!

Ticket Information

Tickets are $15. Seating is General Admission.

Each person is responsible for purchasing their own ticket. For reservations, please contact the theater. Their box office information is here: http://www.thecontemporarytheater.com/boxoffice/index.htm.

Please do not wait to order your tickets! I strongly recommend that you order your tickets now.

Meet-up Logistics

I will provide my cell number when you RSVP.  Meet in the lobby of the theater by 6:30.  Note that, since the seating is general admission, we will enter the theater as soon as the doors open.  If you are running late, please contact me so we can hold a seat for you.
item.how_to_find_us: In the lobby of the theater
item.name: Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind
